meanings.definition: The act of canceling or annulling something.
meanings.sent1: The cancellations of the flights caused inconvenience to many passengers.
meanings.sent2: The school had to make several cancellations due to the snowstorm.
meanings.sent3: The cancellations of the party left everyone disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The cancellations on the calendar made it look messy.
meanings.sent5: The cancellations of the orders saved the company money.

meanings.definition: The process of calling off an event or arrangement.
meanings.sent1: Last-minute cancellations of the concert disappointed the fans.
meanings.sent2: The cancellations of the picnic were due to the rainy weather.
meanings.sent3: The cancellations of the meeting made everyone secretly relieved.
meanings.sent4: The cancellations of the wedding felt like a sudden storm.
meanings.sent5: The cancellations of the trip were unexpected but necessary.

meanings.definition: The marks or lines used to indicate that something has been deleted or crossed out.
meanings.sent1: Her notebook was full of cancellations and corrections.
meanings.sent2: The cancellations on the document made it hard to read.
meanings.sent3: The cancellations on the test paper showed where she changed her answers.
meanings.sent4: The cancellations on the map confused the travelers.
meanings.sent5: The cancellations on the contract were a sign of negotiation.
